newsitem.title: GHANA: Ghana's first main crop cocoa arrives at Tema Port.
newsitem.headline: Ghana's first main crop cocoa arrives at Tema Port.

text.p: Ghana's Cocoa Marketing Company, a subsidiary of state marketing board COCOBOD, has taken delivery of the first consignment of main crop cocoa of the 1996/97 season, officials and industry sources said on Wednesday.
The consignment of 32.6 tonnes (510 bags of 64 kg) was delivered by Universal Crop Protection (Unicrop) to Tema sea port last week, one official told Reuters.
A director of Unicrop, Emmanuel Sam, confirmed that his company had delivered 510 bags to CMC at Tema.
In Ghana, export of cocoa is still a monopoly of the state-run Cocoa Marketing Board but domestic trade has been liberalised.
The main crop season began on October 11.
Estimates of Ghana's 1995/96 output range from 390,000 to 420,000 tonnes.
A Cocoa Producers' Alliance estimate forecast 1996/97 output of around 350,000 tonnes. A U.S. Agriculture Department estimate for the 1996/97 season projected output of 390,000 tonnes.
